page.title: 19A FISHERMANS FAMILY
page.content: I LIVE IN A FISHING FAMILY AND MY FATHER HAS BEEN A FISHERMAN FOR ABOUT 25 YEARS. MY TWO GRANDFATHERS WERE FISHERMEN TOO. MY FATHER LEAVES AT APPROXIMATELY 1O.3O PM ON SUNDAY NIGHT FROM THE HOUSE. HIM AND THE OTHER FIVE CREW MEMBERS TRAVEL DOWN TO PETERHEAD WHERE THEY ARE, AT THE MOMENT, FISHING OUT OF. THE BOAT IS CALLED THE "MORNING STAR". IT IS A BUCKIE REGISTERED VESSEL AND THE NUMBER IS BCK 1O. THEY FISH ABOUT 1OO MILES OFF OF PETERHEAD. THEY HAVE TO STEAM FOR ABOUT 1O HOURS BEFORE THEY REACH THE FISHING GROUNDS. THEY HAVE SPECIAL NETS FOR DIFFERENT KINDS OF FISH. THE AVERAGE BOXES OF FISH THEY CATCH IN A WEEK WOULD BE ABOUT 15O.
